qas.question: Who are blamed in this paragraph for Jim Crow laws?
When did Virginia add the one drop rule to their laws?
What fact was ignored by enacting one-drop rule laws?

answers.text: that many whites had multiracial ancestry.

qas.question: Why were laws limiting people of color passed?
What had popularity in the early 20th century that caused rising racial discrimination?

answers.text: eugenics and ideas of racial purity

qas.question: What continued to be enacted in new laws in the 21st century?
What state enacted the two-drop rule?
What kind of laws had been proposed and passed in the late 19th century in South Carolina?
Who gained political power in the south by enfranchising blacks?
In what years did democrats pass laws to impose Jim Crow?

context: <b5_0>Racial discrimination<b5_0/> continued to be enacted in new laws in the 20th century, for instance the one-drop rule was enacted in <b6_0>Virginia<b6_0/>'s <a1_0>1924<a1_0/> Racial Integrity Law and in other southern states, in part influenced by the popularity of <a4_0>eugenics and ideas of racial purity<a4_0/>. People buried fading memories <a2_0>that many whites had multiracial ancestry.<a2_0/> Many families were multiracial. <b7_0>Similar<b7_0/> laws had been proposed but not passed in the late nineteenth century in South Carolina and Virginia, for instance. After regaining political power in Southern states by disenfranchising blacks, <a0_0><b8_0>white Democrats<b8_0/><a0_0/> passed laws to impose Jim Crow and racial segregation <a3_0>to restore white supremacy<a3_0/>. They maintained these until forced to change in the <b9_0>1960s<b9_0/> and after by enforcement of federal legislation authorizing oversight of practices to protect the constitutional rights of African Americans and other minority citizens.
